title: Deploying to shinyapps.io
text: Signup deploy app RStudio’s shinyapps.io need ShinyApps account. don’t already one can sign https://www.shinyapps.io/. limit number different ShinyStan apps can deploy limit set RStudio type ShinyApps account sign . Setup finish signing ShinyApps account instructions setting account local system using rsconnect::setAccountInfo() (requires first installing rsconnect package) name ShinyApps account name, token secret can found ShinyApps account web page.
code: rsconnect::setAccountInfo(name, token, secret)

what: Step 2: Use deploy_shinystan to deploy your app to shinyapps.io
title: Deploying to shinyapps.io
text: deploy_shinystan function deploy ShinyStan app unique model RStudio’s ShinyApps service. example assume my_sso shinystan object want use name want use app MyModel username ShinyApps account (Step 1) username. deploy app use command specify account argument multiple ShinyApps accounts configured local system account argument required. single account can omit account Graphical posterior predictive checks: optional ppcheck_data ppcheck_yrep arguments vector observations y want use ShinyStan’s graphical posterior predictive checks can also specify optional ppcheck_data argument ’ve specified ppcheck_data argument can also use ppcheck_yrep argument tell ShinyStan name parameter/quantity model containing posterior predictive simulations/replications preselected parameter use graphical posterior predictive checks. never required can also set manually using app, helpful want people view model online avoids need communicate parameter need select. parameter/quantity containing posterior predictive replications named yRep use deployment process successful url app printed console open web browser. can also view app going https://www.shinyapps.io logging account.
code: deploy_shinystan(my_sso, appName = "MyModel", account = "username") deploy_shinystan(my_sso, appName = "MyModel") deploy_shinystan(my_sso, appName = "MyModel",                   ppcheck_data = y) deploy_shinystan(my_sso, appName = "MyModel",                   ppcheck_data = y, ppcheck_yrep = "yRep")

previous_headings: Using the ShinyStan app with different types of objects
title: Getting Started
text: my_stanfit stanfit object (result fitting model rstan), launch ShinyStan app simply use ShinyStan launch. my_sso name want use shinystan object returned. simply run ShinyStan launch shinystan object saved upon quitting app. Sometimes keeping subset parameters can improve performance. can done creating object .shinystan specifying pars argument. resulting shinystan object can passed launch_shinystan().
code: library(shinystan) my_sso <- launch_shinystan(my_stanfit) launch_shinystan(my_stanfit)

title: Getting Started
text: mcmc.list object called my_mcmc can use .shinystan function convert my_mcmc shinystan object can used launch_shinystan: , example, first 100 iterations chain my_mcmc warmup iterations, add warmup argument call .shinystan: However, use warmup argument warmup iterations saved included my_mcmc.
code: my_sso <- launch_shinystan(as.shinystan(my_mcmc, model_name = "my_model")) my_sso <- launch_shinystan(as.shinystan(my_mcmc, model_name = "my_model", warmup = 100))

title: Getting Started
text: convert 3-D array shinystan object make sure three dimensions array correspond number iterations x number chains x number parameters. can .shinystan exactly ’s used examples mcmc.list objects (don’t need convert array mcmc.list).

previous_headings: Using the ShinyStan app with different types of objects > Other types of objects
title: Getting Started
text: separate chains matrix (iterations rows parameters columns) can combine list pass .shinystan
code: # Generate some fake data chain1 <- cbind(beta1 = rnorm(100), beta2 = rnorm(100), sigma = rexp(100)) chain2 <- cbind(beta1 = rnorm(100), beta2 = rnorm(100), sigma = rexp(100)) chain_list <- list(chain1, chain2) my_sso <- launch_shinystan(as.shinystan(X = list(chain1, chain2), model_name = "my_model"))

previous_headings: Other functions in the shinystan package
title: Getting Started
text: can add new parameter/quantity function one two existing parameters shinystan object using generate_quantity function. example, assume sso shinystan object two parameters alpha beta. add parameter gamma inverse logit beta using code , fun function want use, param1 name parameter apply function , new_name name give new parameter. Adding parameter function two parameters just requires specifying param2 argument providing function two variables. example, can add parameter delta sso squared difference alpha beta like
code: inv_logit <- function(x) 1/(1 + exp(-x)) sso <- generate_quantity(sso, fun = inv_logit, param1 = "beta", new_name = "gamma") sso <- generate_quantity(sso, fun = function(x,y) (x-y)^2,                        param1 = "alpha", param2 = "beta", new_name = "delta")

previous_headings: Other functions in the shinystan package
what: Storing your model code in a shinystan object
title: Getting Started
text: models fit using rstan model code automatically stored model_code slot shinystan object. ShinyStan open can view model code Model Code tab. use rstan fit model can add model code using model_code() function. example, may used Bugs JAGS software want add following code shinystan object. add code can simply include code argument model_code function
code: for (i in 1:length(Y)) {      Y[i] ~ dpois(lambda[i])      log(lambda[i]) <- inprod(X[i,], theta[])    }    for (j in 1:J) {      theta[j] ~ dt(0.0, 1.0, 1.0)    }  } my_code <- "  model {   for (i in 1:length(Y)) {      Y[i] ~ dpois(lambda[i])      log(lambda[i]) <- inprod(X[i,], theta[])    }    for (j in 1:J) {      theta[j] ~ dt(0.0, 1.0, 1.0)    }  } "  # Add the code to a shinystan object sso sso <- model_code(sso, code = my_code)

previous_headings: Other functions in the shinystan package
title: Getting Started
text: home page ShinyStan display model name associated shinystan object used. name can set adding model_name argument .shinystan creating shinystan object. existing shinystan object can use model_name function like : "new_model_name" new name want give model.
code: sso <- model_name(sso, "new_model_name")

code: @Manual{,   title = {shinystan: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models},   author = {Jonah Gabry and Duco Veen},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2.7.0.9000},   url = {https://mc-stan.org/shinystan/}, }

what: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: ShinyStan provides immediate, informative, customizable visual numerical summaries model parameters convergence diagnostics MCMC simulations. ShinyStan interface coded primarily R using Shiny web application framework available via shinystan R package.

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: mc-stan.org/shinystan (Website online documentation) Ask question (Stan Forums Discourse) Open issue (GitHub issues bug reports, feature requests)

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: Install latest release CRAN: Install development version GitHub (requires devtools package):
code: install.packages("shinystan") if (!require("devtools")) {   install.packages("devtools") } devtools::install_github("stan-dev/shinystan", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: installing run
code: library("shinystan") launch_shinystan_demo()

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: Applied Bayesian data analysis primarily implemented MCMC algorithms offered various software packages. analyzing posterior sample obtained one algorithms first step check signs chains converged target distribution also signs algorithm might require tuning might ill-suited given model. may also theoretical problems practical inefficiencies specification model. ShinyStan provides interactive plots tables helpful analyzing posterior sample, particular attention identifying potential problems performance MCMC algorithm specification model. ShinyStan powered RStudio’s Shiny web application framework works output MCMC programs written programming language (extended functionality models fit using RStan -U-Turn sampler).

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: shinystan package allows store basic components entire project (code, posterior samples, graphs, tables, notes) single object. Users can save many plots ggplot2 objects customization easy integration reports post-processing publication. shinystan also provides deploy_shinystan function, lets easily deploy ShinyStan apps online using RStudio’s ShinyApps service models. apps (models) unique url compatible Safari, Firefox, Chrome, browsers.

title: Interactive Visual and Numerical Diagnostics and Posterior Analysis for Bayesian Models
text: shinystan R package ShinyStan interface open source licensed GNU Public License, version 3 (GPLv3).

what: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
text: .shinystan function creates shinystan   objects can used launch_shinystan various   functions shinystan package. .shinystan   generic shinystan package provides several methods.   Currently methods provided creating shinystan objects   arrays, lists matrices, stanfit objects (rstan),   stanreg objects (rstanarm), mcmc.list objects   (coda). .shinystan tests object shinystan object.

title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
code: as.shinystan(X, ...)  is.shinystan(X)  # S4 method for class 'array' as.shinystan(   X,   model_name = "unnamed model",   warmup = 0,   burnin = 0,   param_dims = list(),   model_code = NULL,   note = NULL,   sampler_params = NULL,   algorithm = NULL,   max_treedepth = NULL,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'list' as.shinystan(   X,   model_name = "unnamed model",   warmup = 0,   burnin = 0,   param_dims = list(),   model_code = NULL,   note = NULL,   sampler_params = NULL,   algorithm = NULL,   max_treedepth = NULL,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'mcmc.list' as.shinystan(   X,   model_name = "unnamed model",   warmup = 0,   burnin = 0,   param_dims = list(),   model_code = NULL,   note = NULL,   ... )  # S4 method for class 'stanfit' as.shinystan(X, pars, model_name = X@model_name, note = NULL, ...)  # S4 method for class 'stanreg' as.shinystan(X, ppd = TRUE, seed = 1234, model_name = NULL, note = NULL, ...)  # S4 method for class 'CmdStanMCMC' as.shinystan(X, pars = NULL, model_name = NULL, note = NULL, ...)  # S4 method for class 'CmdStanMCMC_CSV' as.shinystan(X, pars = NULL, model_name = NULL, note = NULL, ...)

title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
text: X .shinystan, object converted shinystan object. See Methods section . .shinystan, object check. ... Arguments passed individual methods. model_name string giving name model. warmup number iterations treat warmup. 0 warmup iterations included X. burnin Deprecated. Use warmup instead. burnin argument removed future release. param_dims Rarely used never necessary. named list giving dimensions parameters. scalar parameters use 0 dimension. See Examples. model_code Optionally, character string code used run model. can also added shinystan object later using model_code function. See model_code additional formatting instructions. launching app code viewable Model Code tab. stanfit (rstan) stanreg (rstanarm) objects model code automatically retrieved object. note Optionally, text display Notepad page 'ShinyStan' GUI (stored user_model_info slot shinystan object). sampler_params, algorithm, max_treedepth Rarely used never necessary. using .shinystan method arrays lists, arguments can used manually provide information automatically retrieved stanfit object using .shinystan method stanfit objects. specified, sampler_params must structure object returned get_sampler_params (rstan), list matrices, one matrix per chain. algorithm, specified, must either "NUTS" "HMC" (static HMC). algorithm "NUTS" max_treedepth (integer indicating maximum allowed treedepth model fit) must also provided. pars stanfit objects (rstan), optional character vector specifying parameters included shinystan object. ppd stanreg objects (rstanarm), ppd (logical) indicates whether draw posterior predictive distribution launching app. default TRUE, although large objects can convenient set FALSE drawing posterior predictive distribution can time consuming. ppd TRUE graphical posterior predictive checks available 'ShinyStan' launched. seed Passed pp_check (rstanarm) ppd TRUE.

title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
text: .shinystan returns shinystan object,   instance S4 class "shinystan". .shinystan returns TRUE tested object   shinystan object FALSE otherwise.

title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
text: .shinystan(array): Create shinystan object 3-D array simulations. array dimensions corresponding iterations, chains, parameters, order. .shinystan(list): Create shinystan object list matrices. matrix (2-D array) contain simulations individual chain matrices number iterations (rows) parameters (columns). Parameters names order. .shinystan(mcmc.list): Create shinystan object mcmc.list object (coda). .shinystan(stanfit): Create shinystan object stanfit object (rstan). Fewer optional arguments available method important information can taken automatically stanfit object. .shinystan(stanreg): Create shinystan object stanreg object (rstanarm). .shinystan(CmdStanMCMC): Create shinystan object CmdStanMCMC object (cmdstanr). .shinystan(CmdStanMCMC_CSV): Create shinystan object CmdStanMCMC_CSV object created using cmdstanr::as_cmdstan_fit() (cmdstanr).

title: Create and test shinystan objects — as.shinystan
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ sso <- as.shinystan(X, ...) # replace ... with optional arguments or omit it launch_shinystan(sso) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{    ######################## ### list of matrices ### ########################  # Generate some fake data chain1 <- cbind(beta1 = rnorm(100), beta2 = rnorm(100), sigma = rexp(100)) chain2 <- cbind(beta1 = rnorm(100), beta2 = rnorm(100), sigma = rexp(100)) sso <- as.shinystan(list(chain1, chain2)) launch_shinystan(sso)  # We can also specify some or all of the optional arguments # note: in order to use param_dims we need to rename 'beta1' and 'beta2' # to 'beta[1]' and 'beta[2]' colnames(chain1) <- colnames(chain2) <- c(paste0("beta[",1:2,"]"), "sigma") sso2 <- as.shinystan(list(chain1, chain2),                       model_name = "Example", warmup = 0,                       param_dims = list(beta = 2, sigma = 0)) launch_shinystan(sso2) } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ###################### ### stanfit object ### ###################### library("rstan") fit <- stan_demo("eight_schools") sso <- as.shinystan(fit, model_name = "example") } # }  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ###################### ### stanreg object ### ###################### library("rstanarm") example("example_model") sso <- as.shinystan(example_model) launch_shinystan(sso) } # }

Optional arguments. See Details. deploy app deployed? reason FALSE just want check preprocessing deployment successful.

title: Deploy a 'ShinyStan' app on the web using 'shinyapps.io' by 'RStudio' — deploy_shinystan
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # For this example assume sso is the name of the \code{shinystan} object for # the model you want to use. Assume also that you want to name your app # 'my-model' and that your shinyapps.io username is 'username'.  deploy_shinystan(sso, appName = "my-model", account = "username")  # If you only have one ShinyApps account configured then you can also omit # the 'account' argument.  deploy_shinystan(sso, appName = "my-model") } # }

what: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
title: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
text: Remove selected parameters shinystan object. useful large shinystan object want look subset parameters. smaller shinystan object, launch_shinystan faster experience better performance (responsiveness) launching using 'ShinyStan' app.

title: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
code: drop_parameters(sso, pars)

title: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
text: sso shinystan object. pars character vector parameter names. name non-scalar (e.g. vector, matrix) parameter included pars elements removed. Currently possible remove subset elements non-scalar parameter.

title: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
text: sso, pars dropped.

title: Drop parameters from a shinystan object — drop_parameters
code: # Using example shinystan object 'eight_schools' print(eight_schools@param_names)  # Remove the scalar parameters mu and tau sso <- drop_parameters(eight_schools, pars = c("mu", "tau")) print(sso@param_names)  # Remove all elements of the parameter vector theta sso <- drop_parameters(sso, pars = "theta") print(sso@param_names)

what: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
title: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
text: Add shinystan object new parameter function one two existing parameters.

title: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
code: generate_quantity(sso, param1, param2, fun, new_name)

title: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
text: sso shinystan object. param1 Name first parameter character string. param2 Optional. Name second parameter character string. fun Function call, .e. function(param1) function(param1,param2). See Examples, . new_name Name new parameter character string.

title: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
text: sso, updated. See Examples.

title: Add new quantity to shinystan object — generate_quantity
code: # Using example shinystan object 'eight_schools' sso <- eight_schools sso <- generate_quantity(sso, fun = function(x) x^2,                           param1 = "tau", new_name = "tau_sq") sso <- generate_quantity(sso, fun = "-",                           param1 = "theta[1]", param2 = "theta[2]",                           new_name = "theta1minus2")

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
text: Launch 'ShinyStan' app default web browser. 'RStudio' users also option launching app pop-Viewer.

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
code: launch_shinystan(object, ...)  # Default S3 method launch_shinystan(object, ..., rstudio = getOption("shinystan.rstudio"))  # S3 method for class 'shinystan' launch_shinystan(object, ..., rstudio = getOption("shinystan.rstudio"))

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
text: object object use. default method can object class "shinystan", "stanfit", "stanreg". use types objects first create shinystan object using .shinystan. ... Optional arguments passed runApp. rstudio relevant 'RStudio' users. default (FALSE) launch app user's default web browser rather pop-Viewer provided 'RStudio'. Users can change default TRUE setting global option options(shinystan.rstudio = TRUE).

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
text: launch_shinystan function used side effect   starting 'ShinyStan' app, also returns shinystan   object, instance S4 class "shinystan".

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
text: Muth, C., Oravecz, Z., Gabry, J. (2018) User-friendly Bayesian regression modeling: tutorial rstanarm shinystan. Quantitative Methods Psychology. 14(2), 99–119. https://www.tqmp.org/RegularArticles/vol14-2/p099/p099.pdf Gabry, J. , Simpson, D. , Vehtari, . , Betancourt, M.   Gelman, . (2019), Visualization Bayesian workflow.   *J. R. Stat. Soc. *, 182: 389-402. doi:10.1111/rssa.12378   ([journal version](https://rss.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/rssa.12378),    [preprint arXiv:1709.01449](https://arxiv.org/abs/1709.01449),    [code GitHub](https://github.com/jgabry/bayes-vis-paper))

title: Launch the 'ShinyStan' app — launch_shinystan
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ####################################### # Example 1: 'sso' is a shinystan object #######################################  # Just launch shinystan launch_shinystan(sso)  # Launch shinystan and replace sso with an updated version of itself # if any changes are made to sso while using the app sso <- launch_shinystan(sso)  # Launch shinystan but save any changes made to sso while running the app # in a new shinystan object sso2. sso will remained unchanged.  sso2 <- launch_shinystan(sso)   ####################################### # Example 2: 'sf' is a stanfit object #######################################  # Just launch shinystan launch_shinystan(sf)  # Launch shinystan and save the resulting shinystan object sf_sso <- launch_shinystan(sf)  # Now sf_sso is a shinystan object and so Example 1 (above) applies when # using sf_sso.   ####################################### # Example 3: 'fit' is an mcmc.list, array or list of matrices #######################################  # First create shinystan object (see ?as.shinystan) for full details) } # }

See  Meta Analysis chapter 'Stan' manual  https://mc-stan.org/users/documentation/. rstudio relevant 'RStudio' users. default (FALSE) launch app user's default web browser rather pop-Viewer provided 'RStudio'. Users can change default TRUE setting global option options(shinystan.rstudio = TRUE). ... Optional arguments passed runApp.

title: rename_model (deprecated) — rename_model
code: rename_model(sso, new_model_name)

title: rename_model (deprecated) — rename_model

what: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
text: shinystan object get rhat, effective sample size, posterior quantiles, means, standard deviations, sampler diagnostics, etc.

title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
code: retrieve(sso, what, ...)

title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
text: sso shinystan object. want get? See Details, . ... Optional arguments, particular pars specify parameter names (default parameters used). NUTS sampler parameters (e.g. stepsize, treedepth) inc_warmup can also specified include/exclude warmup iterations (default FALSE). See Details, .

title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
text: argument can take values . 'Args:   arg' means arg can specified ...   value . "rhat", "Rhat", "r_hat", "R_hat" returns: Rhat statistics. Args: pars "N_eff", "n_eff", "neff", "Neff", "ess", "ESS" returns: Effective sample sizes. Args: pars "mean" returns: Posterior means. Args: pars "sd" returns: Posterior standard deviations. Args: pars "se_mean" "mcse" returns: Monte Carlo standard error. Args: pars "median" returns: Posterior medians. Args: pars. "quantiles" string "quant" (case sensitive) returns: 2.5%, 25%, 50%, 75%, 97.5% posterior quantiles. Args: pars. "avg_accept_stat" string "accept" (case sensitive) returns: Average value "accept_stat" (average acceptance probability NUTS subtree). Args: inc_warmup "prop_divergent" string "diverg" (case sensitive) returns: Proportion divergent iterations chain. Args: inc_warmup "max_treedepth" string "tree" "depth" (case sensitive) returns: Maximum treedepth chain. Args: inc_warmup "avg_stepsize" string "step" (case sensitive) returns: Average stepsize chain. Args: inc_warmup

title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
text: Sampler diagnostics (e.g. "avg_accept_stat") available   models originally fit using Stan.

title: Get summary statistics from shinystan object — retrieve
code: # Using example shinystan object 'eight_schools' sso <- eight_schools retrieve(sso, "rhat") retrieve(sso, "mean", pars = c('theta[1]', 'mu')) retrieve(sso, "quantiles") retrieve(sso, "max_treedepth")  # equivalent to retrieve(sso, "depth"), retrieve(sso, "tree"), etc. retrieve(sso, "prop_divergent") retrieve(sso, "prop_divergent", inc_warmup = TRUE)

title: S4 shinystan objects — shinystan-class
text: See .shinystan documentation creating   shinystan objects eight_schools example   object.

title: S4 shinystan objects — shinystan-class
text: model_name ("character") Model name. param_names ("character") Parameter names. param_dims ("list") Parameter dimensions. posterior_sample ("array") MCMC sample. summary ("matrix") Summary stats posterior_sample. sampler_params ("list") Sampler parameters (certain Stan models ). n_chain ("integer") Number chains. n_iter ("integer") Number iterations per chain. n_warmup ("integer") Number warmup iterations per chain. user_model_info ("character") Notes display Notepad page 'ShinyStan' GUI. model_code ("character") Model code display Model Code page 'ShinyStan' GUI. misc ("list") Miscellaneous, internal use.

title: S4 shinystan objects — shinystan-class
text: Muth, C., Oravecz, Z., Gabry, J. (2018) User-friendly Bayesian regression modeling: tutorial rstanarm shinystan. Quantitative Methods Psychology. 14(2), 99–119. https://www.tqmp.org/RegularArticles/vol14-2/p099/p099.pdf

title: View or change metadata associated with a shinystan object — shinystan-metadata

title: View or change metadata associated with a shinystan object — shinystan-metadata
text: sso shinystan object. code string, containing model code added, can used argument cat. See Examples. note string containing note add existing notes replace existing notes, depending value replace. replace TRUE existing notes overwritten note note specified. FALSE (default) note specified content appended existing notes. name string giving new model name use.

title: View or change metadata associated with a shinystan object — shinystan-metadata
text: sso_info prints basic metadata including number parameters,   chains, iterations, warmup iterations, etc. return anything. model_code returns replaces model code stored   shinystan object. code NULL existing   model code stored sso returned character string.   code specified updated shinystan object   returned code added. shinystan objects created   stanfit (rstan) stanreg (rstanarm) objects, model code   automatically taken object need added   manually. within 'ShinyStan' interface model code can viewed   Model Code page. notes returns, amends, replaces notes stored   shinystan object. note NULL existing   notes stored sso returned character string.   note specified updated shinystan object   returned either note added previous notes (  replace=FALSE) overwritten note (replace =   TRUE). within 'ShinyStan' interface, notes viewable   Notepad page. model_name returns replaces model name associated   shinystan object. name NULL current   model name returned. name specified sso   returned updated model name.

title: View or change metadata associated with a shinystan object — shinystan-metadata
code: # use eight_schools example object sso <- eight_schools  ################ ### sso_info ### ################  sso_info(sso)  ################## ### model_code ### ##################  # view model code in example shinystan object 'eight_schools' cat(model_code(sso))  # change the model code in sso  # some jags style code my_code <- "  model {    for (i in 1:length(Y)) {      Y[i] ~ dpois(lambda[i])      log(lambda[i]) <- inprod(X[i,], theta[])    }    for (j in 1:J) {      theta[j] ~ dt(0.0, 1.0, 1.0)    }  } " sso <- model_code(sso, my_code) cat(model_code(sso))  ############# ### notes ### #############  # view existing notes notes(sso)  # add a note to the existing notes sso <- notes(sso, "New note") notes(sso) cat(notes(sso))  # replace existing notes sso <- notes(sso, "replacement note", replace = TRUE) notes(sso)   ################## ### model_name ### ##################  # view model name model_name(sso)  # change model name sso <- model_name(sso, "some other name") identical(model_name(sso), "some other name")

title: shinystan 2.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-12-12 .shinystan() compatibility cmdstanr::as_cmdstan_fit() @jgabry https://github.com/stan-dev/shinystan/pull/207 Change size linewidth (except geom_point element_text) @jgabry https://github.com/stan-dev/shinystan/pull/205 Added pkgdown workflow new theme @VisruthSK https://github.com/stan-dev/shinystan/pull/206 Added logo displayed r-universe @avehtari https://github.com/stan-dev/shinystan/pull/201

title: shinystan 2.6.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-03-02 Initial support CmdStanMCMC objects CmdStanR Moved rsconnect package Imports Suggests requested CRAN

title: shinystan 2.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-01 New website online documentation: https://mc-stan.org/shinystan Fixed problem extracting info fits reconstructed CSV files (#128,#158), thanks @martinmodrak

title: shinystan 2.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-08-02 launch_shinystan now S3 generic methods. allows developers packages use shinystan create launch_shinystan methods instead using different function name creating naming conflict.

title: shinystan 2.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-02-01

title: shinystan 2.3.0
text: Fix various issues resulting errors models fit using static HMC (thanks Cole Monnahan). Deprecate burnin argument .shinystan. Use warmup instead. relevant models fit using Stan.

title: shinystan 2.3.0
text: Add NUTS energy diagnostic plots Diagnose page Allowing passing sampler_params .shinystan. makes possible display sampler diagnositcs HMC/NUTS even using Stan’s implementation algorithms (thanks Cole Monnahan).

title: shinystan 2.2.1
text: CRAN release: 2016-08-31 Better compatibility latest releases ‘shinyjs’ ‘DT’ packages shinystan::launch_shinystan_demo() now works without first load package call library Unless running server, app now stops running browser tab closed

title: shinystan 2.2.0-1
text: Fix bug deploy_shinystan preventing ShinyStan apps deployed

title: shinystan 2.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-05-25 Add optional argument pars .shinystan method stanfit objects, allowing subset parameters selected inclusion resulting shinystan object. Introduce drop_parameters function removing parameters shinystan object (useful large objects want look subset parameters). Add rstanarm Suggests (DESCRIPTION file) rstanarm::pp_check can called. Allow selecting yrep global environment PPcheck Change .shinystan S4 generic methods Add rsconnect Imports DESCRIPTION. Rename slots shinystan objects. update_sso function can used ensure old shinystan objects internal structure compatible release. Improve line coverage api tests

title: shinystan 2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2016-01-06 Compatibility recent ggplot2 update Select parameters via regular expressions parameters plot (‘Estimate’ page) Fix error selecting entire parameter group parameters plot (‘Estimate’ page)

title: shinystan 2.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2015-09-17 Fixes small bugs typos Adds support stanreg objects Moves ggplot2 Depends Imports

title: shinystan 2.0.0 (major update, initial CRAN release)
text: CRAN release: 2015-08-10 Version 2.0.0 new look, new(ish) name, lot new functionality. Many bugs also fixed (see GitHub issue tracker).

title: shinystan 2.0.0 (major update, initial CRAN release)
text: name R package shinystan app/GUI ShinyStan.

what: Some of the new features in ShinyStan app
title: shinystan 2.0.0 (major update, initial CRAN release)
text: Rebranding (new look reflect changes Stan logo website) HMC/NUTS diagnostic plots (‘Diagnose’ page, ‘HMC/NUTS (plots)’ tab) Specify transformations (e.g. log, logit, sqrt, etc.) density, histogram, bivariate, trivariate plots (‘Explore’ page) HMC/NUTS diagnostics plots. Many plots can now also saved pdf Bivariate scatterplot plot also shows divergent transitions max treedepth saturation (‘Explore’ page) detailed glossary entries (Experimental) Introduce basic graphical posterior predictive checking (‘Diagnose’ page, ‘PPcheck’ tab) limited class models Option show partial autocorrelations (‘Diagnose’ page, ‘Autocorrelation’ tab) Better customization posterior summary statistics table Many improvements GUI design
